taxonomicnotes: Often erroneously called Nemacheilus barbatulus, Cobitis barbatula or Orthrias barbatula. Several species are apparently confused under the name B. barbatula. Recent molecular studies suggest that several species are lumped under this name and a taxonomic revision is needed to settle this problem.
rationale:
A widespread species with no known major widespread threats.

European Union 27 = LC. Rationale same as above.
